pullRequest.body:
This PR proves that the properties `PreservesSheafification` and `WEqualsLocallyBijective` hold for an essentially small site if they hold for an equivalent small site.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Could you try to investigate if there are more general classes of functors between sites which preserve/reflect locally injective/surjective morphisms? For example, the postcomposition with functors like `Over.forget` must preserve locally injective and locally surjective morphisms; does this hold more generally for `CoverPreserving` or `CoverLifting` functors? In the other direction, is the `IsCoverDense` condition (+ fully/faithful) sufficient? I think it would be better to prove suitable general results, and then apply them to equivalences.

Indeed, `IsCocontinuous` is enough to preserve local surjectivity. I haven't managed to prove the other direction for a cover dense fully faithful functor, I'm not sure how to relate the image sieve and `coverByImage`. Here is a start (edited, I initially wrote down a stupid approach which led to a goal which amounted to proving objectwise surjectivity of `f` on images of `H`):

```lean
lemma isLocallySurjective_of_whisker' (H : D ⥤ C) [H.IsCoverDense J] [H.Full] [H.Faithful]
    [IsLocallySurjective (H.inducedTopologyOfIsCoverDense J) (whiskerLeft H.op f)] :
      IsLocallySurjective J f where
  imageSieve_mem {X} a := by
    have := Functor.IsCoverDense.is_cover (G := H) (K := J) X
    refine GrothendieckTopology.superset_covering _ ?_ this
    intro Y g ⟨⟨Z, lift, map, fac⟩⟩
    let b := (forget A).map (G.map map.op) a
    have hh := IsLocallySurjective.imageSieve_mem (f := (whiskerLeft H.op f))
      (J := H.inducedTopologyOfIsCoverDense J) b
    sorry
```

but I haven't managed to use `hh` yet.

Ok, here is a more promising approach:

```lean
lemma isLocallySurjective_of_whisker' (H : D ⥤ C) [H.IsCoverDense J] [H.Full] [H.Faithful]
    [IsLocallySurjective (H.inducedTopologyOfIsCoverDense J) (whiskerLeft H.op f)] :
      IsLocallySurjective J f where
  imageSieve_mem {X} a := by
    have := Functor.IsCoverDense.is_cover (G := H) (K := J) X
    apply J.transitive this
    intro Y g ⟨⟨Z, lift, map, fac⟩⟩
    rw [← fac, Sieve.pullback_comp]
    apply J.pullback_stable

    let b := (forget A).map (G.map map.op) a
    have hh := IsLocallySurjective.imageSieve_mem (f := (whiskerLeft H.op f))
      (J := H.inducedTopologyOfIsCoverDense J) b
    change _ ∈ J.sieves _ at hh
    have : imageSieve (whiskerLeft H.op f) b =
        (Sieve.pullback map (imageSieve f a)).functorPullback H := by
      sorry
    rw [this] at hh
    exact GrothendieckTopology.superset_covering _ (Sieve.functorPullback_pushforward_le H _) hh
```
Ok, the latter approach worked. I bet it can be modified for locally injective as well. I'll finish it and clean up tomorrow.

> Ok, the latter approach worked. I bet it can be modified for locally injective as well. I'll finish it and clean up tomorrow.

The better statement is:
```lean
import Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Sites.LocallySurjective
import Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Sites.DenseSubsite

namespace CategoryTheory.Presheaf

attribute [local instance] ConcreteCategory.hasCoeToSort ConcreteCategory.instFunLike

variable {D C A : Type*} [Category C] [Category D] [Category A] [ConcreteCategory A]
  (H : D ⥤ C) {K : GrothendieckTopology D} {J : GrothendieckTopology C}
  (hH : CoverPreserving K J H) [H.IsCoverDense J]
  {F G : Cᵒᵖ ⥤ A} (φ : F ⟶ G) [IsLocallySurjective K (whiskerLeft H.op φ)]

lemma isLocallySurjective_of_whisker : IsLocallySurjective J φ where
  imageSieve_mem {X} s := by
    let R : ⦃Y : C⦄ → ⦃f : Y ⟶ X⦄ → Sieve.coverByImage H X f → Sieve Y :=
      fun Y f _ => imageSieve φ (G.map f.op s)
    refine J.superset_covering ?_ (J.bind_covering
      (R := R) (H.is_cover_of_isCoverDense J X) ?_)
    · rintro Y f ⟨Z, a, b, hb, ha, rfl⟩
      exact ⟨localPreimage _ _ _ ha, by simp⟩
    · rintro Y f ⟨hf⟩
      refine J.superset_covering ?_ (J.pullback_stable hf.lift
        (hH.cover_preserve (imageSieve_mem K (whiskerLeft H.op φ)
          (U := Opposite.op hf.obj) (G.map hf.map.op s))))
      intro Z a ⟨T, b, c, hb, fac⟩
      refine ⟨F.map c.op (localPreimage _ _ _ hb), ?_⟩
      replace fac := (G ⋙ forget _).congr_map (congr_arg Quiver.Hom.op (fac =≫ hf.map))
      simp only [Category.assoc, op_comp, Functor.map_comp] at fac
      conv_rhs => rw [← hf.fac]
      rw [NatTrans.naturality_apply, app_localPreimage, op_comp, G.map_comp, comp_apply]
      exact (congr_fun fac s).symm

end CategoryTheory.Presheaf

```
Nice, thanks! Actually the proof I wrote using `J.transitive` also works for that statement.

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Sites.Equivalence | 659 | 863 | +204 (+30.96%) |
</details>

All that's left in this PR is now some instances I added in the equivalence file, the preserving and reflecting of local injectivity and surjectivity is #13621

This PR has changed a bit, lots of the initial material has been incorporated into other PRs that have now been merged, but what's left now is still used in #13495 and #14027, so I would appreciate a second round of reviews
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/e0a150f2-b794-4f62-851a-d6413aaaff75) for commit 0ff18e005118ac1ea0afbe7bf1ca0cb7eeefc468.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/d25a6c61-d7c2-4550-a51b-ea62544fdf9d/to/e0a150f2-b794-4f62-851a-d6413aaaff75) against commit ad0a80b0813dff599cb4f00170949b41d1c5dc5d.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10184115169/job/28170662406)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10184115169/job/28170662103)
Please use `H.is_cover_of_isCoverDense`. (In general, we should almost never use `TypeClass.field`, but API lemmas with suitable explicit variables and `[TypeClass]` as a parameter.)

As `IsCocontinous` is the natural assumption, I do not think to include it in the name:
```suggestion
lemma isLocallyInjective_whisker [H.IsCocontinuous J K] [IsLocallyInjective K f] :
```

Similarly:
```suggestion
lemma isLocallyInjective_of_whisker (hH : CoverPreserving J K H)
```
(And same suggestion for the next two lemmas.)

```suggestion
    exact ⟨x, by simpa using h⟩
```

I would think that a better design would be to transport the `WEqualsLocallyBijective`, `HasSheafCompose` and `Balanced` instances via an equivalence. In the applications to specific sites, once these instances have been obtained, we may use `isLocallySurjective_iff_epi'`. This would also allow to use these instances for other purposes that just comparing locally surjective morphisms and epimorphisms. (This can be done in separate PRs.)
You're right, I took the lazy approach.. I'll do it properly :)
I know it is a little bit painful work, but I believe we have most of the ingredients.

It wasn't too bad. However, using this approach one has to assume the existence of certain limits in the target category, so the "lazy" approach is slightly more general. I don't know if it's worth keeping that lemma though (without the limit assumption), because this only applies to concrete categories anyway.

In order to proceed next with this material, I would suggest that for this PR, you keep only the general lemmas `isLocallySurjective/Injective_{/of/iff}_whisker` under quite general conditions (cocontinuous, etc) -- and these should be moved to another (maybe new) file. You may also keep the verification that equivalences are co/continuous in this PR, but the rest should very much be in differents PRs (specifically https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13486/files#diff-fd03ab2b884c2d15f411302648dd33c4f1e0db0c79f4ccaf8824354f59815bffR342-R378 and https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13486/files#diff-fd03ab2b884c2d15f411302648dd33c4f1e0db0c79f4ccaf8824354f59815bffR417-R446); actually, part of this material, especially the first chunk, will eventually be uncessary: suppose I have a site `(C,J)` which is big, and an equivalent one `(D,K)` which is small, we transport the necessary instances from `(D,K)` to `(C,J)` one by one, and then we may apply `isLocallySurjective_iff_epi'` in `(C,J)`. I think this is what you intend to do for the light profinite site, and this is what I intend to do in the future when the categories `C` and `D` are not necessarily equivalent, but at least they would have equivalent categories of sheaves (e.g. `C` is a category of schemes, and `D` is a (small) full subcategory of affines schemes).

Then, after this first PR is merged, we may proceed with transport lemmas, separately for `WEqualsLocallyBijective` (for an equivalence, I do not think we need more `HasLimitsOfShape` assumptions), `HasSheafCompose` and `Balanced`. It will be easier to work on this and review it as separate PRs.

For the transport of `WEqualsLocallyBijective`, I intended an approach where we do not rely on `HasWeakSheafify` and existence of limits, but on the very definition of `W`, taking into consideration that on both equivalent sites, we have equivalent categories of sheaves in order to test the `W` condition.

The exact statement is a little bit technical, so if this is ok for you, after the `isLocallyInjective_iff_whisker` et al. lemmas are merged, I can work on the transport of `WEqualsLocallyBijective`, and you could do the remaining parts. (Ideally, the lemma I intend to prove would apply both for my future intended application and for this application to equivalences of sites..)
Ok, that's completely fine! I'll clean up this PR a bit later this evening and remove everything that's irrelevant.

```suggestion
  [G.Full] [(G.sheafPushforwardContinuous A K J).EssSurj]
```
I would think that this lemma (and the next) should be moved to a more basic file. Otherwise, the PR looks good to me.

```suggestion
      Sieve.pullback (e.unitInv.app U) S := by ext; simp
```

```suggestion
      (Sieve.functorPushforward e.functor S)) = S := by ext; simp
```

```suggestion
    change _ ↔ _ ∈ J.sieves _
    simp [Sieve.functorPushforward_equivalence_eq_pullback]
```
We're probably missing simp lemmas at the `change`.

Now that I think about it more, this is exactly the instance `instance : e.functor.IsDenseSubsite J (e.inverse.inducedTopology J)` a few line prior right? Maybe we could make `TransportsGrothendieckTopology` an abbrev or ditch it completely.

Edit: Potentially in a separate PR.
You're right, it was very easy to just remove this. Let's see if CI finds errors elsewhere, but I think I fixed them all

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory): add some instances for essentially small sites
